alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 7:25PM CDT until May 08 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...Wisconsin...Iowa... Mississippi River at La Crosse affecting La Crosse, Vernon and Houston Counties. Mississippi River at Winona affecting Winona, Trempealeau and Buffalo Counties. Mississippi River at Guttenberg Dam 10 affecting Grant and Clayton Counties. Mississippi River at McGregor affecting Allamakee, Grant, Clayton and Crawford Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota...Wisconsin... Mississippi River at Wabasha affecting Buffalo and Wabasha Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Winona. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Lock and Dam 5A goes out of operation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM CDT Wednesday was 15.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Sunday morning and continue falling to 11.3 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning.
